description: This high-complexity project in the Education industry requires a structured approach with careful attention to stakeholder needs, technical requirements, and quality assurance. The project will be delivered within the 6-12 months timeframe with a budget of Under $10K.
current_state: Charters created manually with inconsistent formatting
Stakeholder inputs captured in scattered docs/spreadsheets
Limited traceability between scope, risks, and dependencies
No standard KPI on charters per month or department
objectives: Deliver a comprehensive My First Project solution that meets all specified requirements
Ensure high-quality deliverables through rigorous testing and quality assurance processes
Maintain project timeline and budget constraints while maximizing value delivery
Establish scalable architecture that supports future growth and enhancements
Provide comprehensive documentation and training for end users and administrators
future_state: Standardized, template-driven charter creation in under 1 hour
Single source of truth for scope, risks, dependencies, and KPIs
Automated HTML/PDF rendering and consistent approvals workflow
Extensible architecture to plug in future features
high_level_requirement: User-friendly learning platform for educators and students
Role-based access for admin, teacher, student
Basic course creation, quizzes, and progress tracking
business_benefit: Faster kick-off cycles and reduced rework
Improved governance via consistent templates and sections
Better visibility with KPIs such as charters per month

project_scope.scope: This project encompasses the complete development lifecycle of My First Project, including requirements analysis, system design, development, testing, deployment, and post-launch support. The scope includes all core functionality, integrations, security implementations, and user training materials. The project will be delivered as a production-ready solution with comprehensive documentation and support materials.
in_scope: Deployment on a low-cost hosting plan

tasks: Archive documentation and finalize closure report

success_criteria: All functional requirements are implemented and tested successfully
System performance meets or exceeds specified benchmarks
User acceptance testing achieves 95% satisfaction rate
Project is delivered within approved timeline and budget
Security requirements are fully implemented and validated
Documentation is complete and approved by stakeholders
End users are successfully trained and onboarded
assumptions: Stakeholders will be available for regular reviews and feedback sessions
Required technical resources and tools will be accessible throughout the project
Third-party integrations and APIs will remain stable during development
Business requirements will remain relatively stable with minimal changes
Adequate testing environments will be available for quality assurance activities
dependencies: Timely input from sponsor and instructors
Availability of test users for UAT

risks_and_mitigation.mitigation: Implement strict change control process and regular stakeholder reviews
Conduct thorough technical research and maintain close collaboration with subject matter experts
Early integration testing and phased rollout approach
Secure key resources early and maintain a backup resource pool

pm_resource_recommendation: 1 Project Manager (0.4 FTE) to coordinate planning, stakeholder communications, risk management, and timeline/budget tracking; recommend PM with EdTech and Agile delivery experience.
lesson_learnt: Freeze the charter template early to avoid dual rework in parsing and rendering
Keep observability simple first (file fallback), add DB logging post-go-live
Bundle assumptions, risks, and dependencies together for faster reviews
